page.title: 03Education in Nailsea
page.content: {Grove County Junior School}was built in 1968. There were until July 1984 two separate buildings, the main building in Whiteoak Way and the Annexe in Church Lane by Holy Trinity Church. Since September 1984 the whole School has been together on the main site. Today, in 1985, there are 378 children in the School in 12 classes. The Teaching Staff consists of the Headteacher and 12.3 Teachers( that means 12 fulltime Teachers each with a class of their own and a part-time Teacher who works three mornings a week.) The Caretaker has three Cleaners to help him look after the buildings. There are 5 people working in the School's Kitchen and 5 "Dinner Ladies" to help look after the children at lunch-time.
